meanings.definition: A horizontal supporting member, typically timber or steel, that forms the structure of a floor or ceiling.
meanings.sent1: The joists in the attic help hold up the roof.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter installed the joists to support the new flooring.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loves to walk along the joists in the basement.
meanings.sent4: The joists of the bridge connected the two sides of the river.
meanings.sent5: The creaking of the joists could be heard throughout the old house.

meanings.definition: To fit or strengthen with joists.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers joisted the beams together for added support.
meanings.sent2: She joists the walls with sturdy timber to ensure stability.
meanings.sent3: He joists the shelves in the garage to organize his tools.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter joisted the structure, making it more durable.
meanings.sent5: They joist the framework carefully to prevent any future damage.
